docs.lead_paragraph: Statins, among the most prescribed drugs for the prevention of cardiovascular disease, also appear to reduce the risk for death in patients hospitalized with the flu.

headline.main: Patterns: Statins May Reduce Risk of Death From Flu
headline.print_headline: Patterns: Statins May Reduce Risk of Death From Flu

docs.abstract: Study published in the The Journal of Infectious Diseases finds that statins, commonly prescribed for the prevention of cardiovascular disease, also appear to reduce the risk for death in patients hospitalized with the flu; study is co-authored by Dr Ann R Thomas of the Oregon Public Health Division.
docs.snippet: Statins, among the most prescribed drugs for the prevention of cardiovascular disease, also appear to reduce the risk for death in patients hospitalized with the flu.

docs.lead_paragraph: Preterm boys in a study had more sleep and attention troubles than their full-term peers, and preterm girls were significantly more emotionally reactive, depressed and withdrawn.

headline.seo: Greater Behavioral Risks for Preemies at Preschool Age
headline.main: Risks: More Woes for Preemies at Preschool Age
headline.print_headline: Risks: More Woes for Preemies at Preschool Age

docs.abstract: Study published in The Archives of Disease in Childhood finds that babies born only three weeks prematurely face an increased risk of behavioral and emotional problems as preschoolers; epidemiologist Sijmen A Reijneveld of the University of Groningen is study's lead author.
docs.snippet: Preterm boys in a study had more sleep and attention troubles than their full-term peers, and preterm girls were significantly more emotionally reactive, depressed and withdrawn.

docs.lead_paragraph: New restrictions on federally financed experiments involving chimpanzees may be a turning point in how humans deal with other species.

headline.seo: Recognition of Chimps as Relatives May Reshape Research
headline.main: Elevation of the Chimp May Reshape Research
headline.print_headline: Elevation of the Chimp May Reshape Research

docs.abstract: News analysis; federal moratorium on grants for research that involve testing on chimpanzees, closest genetic relative of human beings, may be a turning point in how humans deal with other species used in research.
docs.snippet: New restrictions on federally financed experiments involving chimpanzees may be a turning point in how humans deal with other species.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 20 studies, including a large analysis of data on more than 200,000 children, have produced results that link acetaminophen use to an increased risk of asthma.

headline.seo: Evidence Mounts Linking Acetaminophen and Asthma

docs.abstract: More than 20 studies have established credible link between sharp worldwide increase in asthma over the past 30 years and widespread adoption of acetaminophen to replace aspirin use in children; some pediatricians have begun recommending that children with asthma not use acetaminophen.
docs.snippet: More than 20 studies, including a large analysis of data on more than 200,000 children, have produced results that link acetaminophen use to an increased risk of asthma.

docs.lead_paragraph: Edith Widder has spent a career studying sea creatures with the ability to make light — bioluminescence. Now she is using the phenomenon to fight pollution.

headline.seo: A Pollution Fight Powered by Bioluminescent Sea Creatures
headline.main: Illuminating the Perils of Pollution, Nature’s Way
headline.print_headline: Ocean Life Illuminates The Perils Of Pollution

docs.abstract: Marine biologist Edith Widder has developed a technique that uses a bioluminescent bacterium to measure pollution levels in estuary sediment; method is more accurate than simply measuring chemical levels in water, which can give skewed results; has also developed deep-sea ocean-floor camera that uses a type of red light that is capable of observing sea creatures without disturbing them.
docs.snippet: Edith Widder has spent a career studying sea creatures with the ability to make light — bioluminescence. Now she is using the phenomenon to fight pollution.

docs.lead_paragraph: Antonio Lambert, diagnosed with a mood disorder and addiction, manages through faith, medication and companionship - leaning the same "peer specialist" skills he teaches.
docs.snippet: Antonio Lambert, diagnosed with a mood disorder and addiction, manages through faith, medication and companionship - leaning the same "peer specialist" skills he teaches.

byline.original: Damon Winter, Nancy Donaldson and Soo-Jeong Kang

docs.lead_paragraph: Corn tortillas and a spread of flavorful fillings make for festive do-it-yourself meals perfect for a busy week.

headline.seo: Tacos for the Holidays — Recipes for Health

docs.snippet: Corn tortillas and a spread of flavorful fillings make for festive do-it-yourself meals perfect for a busy week.

docs.lead_paragraph: The National Institutes of Health suspended new grants for biomedical and behavioral research on chimpanzees.

headline.seo: U.S. Suspends Use of Chimps in New Research
headline.main: U.S. Will Not Finance New Research on Chimps
headline.print_headline: U.S. Will Not Finance New Research Involving Chimps

docs.abstract: National Institutes of Health suspends all new grants for biomedical and behavioral research on chimpanzees and accepts the first uniform criteria for assessing the necessity of such research; the guidelines require that the research be necessary for human health and that there be no other way to accomplish it.
docs.snippet: The National Institutes of Health suspended new grants for biomedical and behavioral research on chimpanzees.

docs.lead_paragraph: Earthy, herbal flavors make this bean soup stand out.

headline.seo: Puréed White Bean Soup With Pistou — Recipes for Health
headline.main: Puréed White Bean Soup With Pistou

docs.snippet: Earthy, herbal flavors make this bean soup stand out.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new government study of rape and domestic violence found that such attacks may be far more common than previously thought.

headline.seo: Nearly 1 in 5 Women in U.S. Survey Report Sexual Assault
headline.main: Nearly 1 in 5 Women in U.S. Survey Say They Have Been Sexually Assaulted
headline.print_headline: Nearly 1 in 5 Women in U.S. Survey Say They Have Been Sexually Assaulted

docs.abstract: Government survey of rape and domestic violence affirms that sexual violence against women remains endemic in the United States and in some instances may be far more common than previously thought; nearly one in five women say they had been raped or experienced an attempted rape, and one in four report being beaten by an intimate partner.
docs.snippet: A new government study of rape and domestic violence found that such attacks may be far more common than previously thought.
